item.title: Stat 230
item.description: Purpose of this page The purpose of this page is to hold some of the additional materials provided by myself. Students should consult UW Learn system. Course description This course provides an introduction to probability models including sample spaces, mutually exclusive and independent events, conditional probability and Bayesâ€™ Theorem. The named distributions (Discrete Uniform, Hypergeometric, Binomial, Negative Binomial, Geometric, Poisson, Continuous Uniform, Exponential, Normal (Gaussian), and Multinomial) are used to model real phenomena.
